noun.description: A wide-mouthed cylindrical container made of glass or pottery, especially one used for storing food.

verb.description: Send a painful or damaging shock through (something, especially a part of the body)
examples: he jarred his knee in training

verb.description: Have an unpleasant, annoying, or disturbing effect.
examples: a laugh that jarred on the ears
the difference in their background began to jar

origin: Late 17th century: later form of obsolete char turn (see also ajar and charwoman).
